attributes.action: The right to register with two GPs for students studying away from home
attributes.background: Currently in the UK, you can only register to one GP (General Practitioner) at a time. People tend to register to the one nearest to their home address, but what if you're constantly going back and forth between two addresses? This is a problem students studying away from home have to face.
attributes.additional_details:
During each year of study, students receive 3 main holidays, this includes 3-4 weeks at Christmas and Easter and almost 3 months summer holiday. It is not uncommon to need health treatment during these periods, however, receiving the care needed can be a nightmare!

Not all GPs offer temporary registration, imagine the hassle of constantly having to re-register between two GPs. This also causes unnecessary inconvenience for GPs who constantly have to send patients files and data back and forth.

attributes.action: Referendum on whether to scrap the TV license
attributes.background:
A choice to remove the BBC's outdated and unfair, politically biased,  monopoly, by scrapping its license fee.

This decision should be put to the country in a Referendum with the question "Do you want to keep paying for the BBC License? Yes or No"

attributes.action: Base income tax on combined household income for a fair tax system
attributes.background: The current tax system places the highest tax burden by far on single-earner households and many single-earner families are sliding towards poverty due to the unfair tax system while single individuals without children enjoy some of the lowest tax rates of the western world
attributes.additional_details:
The current tax system is based on taxing individuals without taking into account how many additional people such as children depend on that income. It also severly punishes mothers who stay at home, despite research demonstrating that this is the best for young children.
The fairest way to support families is by taxing combined household income. This will also eliminate the unfairness of the High Income Child Benefit Charge threshold, where single-earner families loose the benefit with much lower income than double-earner families.
A tax system that is based on the combined household income is common sense and is the standard in most countries in the western world.
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/women/mother-tongue/8365211/Britain-worst-place-for-tax-burden-on-single-earner-families.html

attributes.action: Permit all public universities to test cannabis for medical use
attributes.background: Cannabis is widely believed to have broad medical applications, and there is solid evidence to support some of these. We cannot know the true extent without research. It seems obvious that the current restriction is based on ideology rather than evidence, and this stance is academically unacceptable
attributes.additional_details: Cannabis has been shown to improve the endurance of cancer patients and to improve the experiences of those with chronic pain.  Cannabis has also been shown to be minimally addictive and minimally harmful to health, whilst the debate over its social detriments has contained more heat than light.  The way to put this to bed, one way or the other, is to let the academics test it and find out exactly what it does.  We permit tests on other classes of drugs including opiates, why not cannabis?

attributes.action: Increase highway maintenance funding to make the roads safe to use
attributes.background: Across the country, roads are in a dangerous state of disrepair. Many signs are dirty, broken or obscured by foliage. Road surfaces are badly potholed. It's likely that this neglect has contributed to deaths and injury. Clearly highway maintenance urgently requires a significant increase in funding.

attributes.action: Stop the introduction of accountable care organisations in the UK.
attributes.background:
In April 2018, Jeremy Hunt aims to establish the first accountable care organisations (ACOs). ACOs will hold multibillion-pound budgets to deliver combined health & social care for large geographical areas.
ACOs will be non-NHS entities.
The NHS was created as a public service & must remain so
attributes.additional_details: Margaret Greenwood has already raised the issue of increased scrutiny on ACOs in parliament and the lack of time for this scrutiny but given the current state of the NHS we must not allow the government to sell it off.

attributes.action: We demand that the Govt. takes immediate action to solve the NHS crisis.
attributes.background:
1. Re-introduce SEN nurses to fill current vacancies
2. Re-introduce a bursary for nurses qualifying via university degree
3. Grant VISAs for Drs and GPs waiting to come to UK
4. Reverse the 'new' contracts forced on hospital doctors
5. Confirm that no further PFIs or PF2s will be agreed
attributes.additional_details:
1. SEN nurses can learn and work at same time and have higher retention rate.
2. Nurses are discouraged by huge cost of university fees
3. There are suitably qualified doctors waiting to join NHS but prevented by no VISA
4. Doctors are working under unfair conditions and should not be forced to work 7 days a week.
5. The burden of PFIs and PF2s are unfairly placed on individual trusts. The Govt. should take out capital loans as they are cheaper in long term. Existing ones should be bought out.

attributes.action: Lower the rate of duty on alcoholic beverages in pubs (and restaurants?)
attributes.background: Pubs form a valuable social and community function in many towns and villages and help to make Britain what it is. Towns and villages with good pubs are better than those without. This should be recognised by Government. It is the role of good Government to make this country a better place to live.
attributes.additional_details:
Communal drinking and socialising forms a valuable function in terms of social cohesion and sense of community. Home drinking or street drinking can be actively detrimental to this. Making retail purchased alcohol relatively more expensive would, I believe, help to discourage this. The alternative of course would be raising the level of duty charged on alcoholic beverages bought from retail outlets.

Many thanks for your time.

attributes.action: Mandatory Autism Awareness training in ALL educational settings
attributes.background: More and more autistic children are loosing out on an education because schools refuse to make reasonable adjustments. We need mandatory Autism Awareness training in ALL educational settings to highlight that small changes can make a huge impact to an individuals education.
attributes.additional_details: Autistic individuals are not difficult or naughty, and they should not be punished with their education at stake when simple adjustments could change the whole educational experience.

attributes.action: Ask Esther McVey to make a further statement to Parliament
attributes.background: Esther McVey's apology over her misrepresentation of the National Audit Office's report into Universal Credit does not stand up to scrutiny. She needs to further explain how she came to be using words that were the polar opposite to the report.

attributes.action: Enable an Emotional Support Dog to be recognised as an Assistance Dog
attributes.background: I have mental health problems, anxiety and depression. My dog helps me get out; keeps me calm in town when it's crowded and stops me acting on suicidal thoughts. My dog has given me a reason to get out of bed. Surely this will also help the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: I have also spoken to other people with mental health and found their dogs have been a huge help to them.”

attributes.action: Drop 4 of the 5 law changes that will affect UK motorists due later in 2018
attributes.background:
There are 5 motoring law changes that will affect the motorists of UK due to come into effect later in the year of 2018.

The new laws that this petition is against cover:
1. New driver restrictions, 2. Changes to VED for diesel cars, 3. MOT changes, 4. Leaner Drivers on motorways.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see this article by DriveTribe for further information as linked below.

https://drivetribe.com/p/five-law-changes-that-will-affect-Utdk30x1QSOK_59b7U6Wfw?iid=Ifgt4G3vSGC2VK9QA6F34A&utm_campaign=idiotukdrivers&utm_medium=fb&utm_source=network

attributes.action: Better health care and awareness for young people with respiratory conditions.
attributes.background: As a young person who suffers from severe Asthma, I've only recently started getting the medical treatment i needed after a lifetime of suffering from the condition (17 years). Unfortunately this is the same for many young people and this is something i would like to change.
attributes.additional_details: In my opinion, GP's are not educated enough about the severity of asthma and other respiratory conditions such as COPD. Hospital treatments are only temporary such as nebulisers and steroid medication and after this, GP's do not provide the sufficient checks to make sure an "attack" does not happen again. Asthma UK and COPD both do fundraising to raise awareness of the severity of both conditions and I feel like the government and the public could do more to help.

attributes.action: Debate a national Long Service and Good Conduct medal for all NHS staff.
attributes.background: We do not recognise the contribution NHS staff make to our local communities and to the nation as a whole.  I feel medals should be awarded at 30 years and 50 years continuous unbroken service to all NHS staff who complete that amount of service.
attributes.additional_details: 30 year medal should be called the Long Service and Good conduct Medal and 50 years service should be called the Meritorious Service Medal.  Unbroken service should include Maternity leave, sick leave and bank staff and part time staff.  The medal should say " From a grateful nation" on it.  Ribbon colours and design should be put to NHS staff for their ideas.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to determine the will of the people for NHS and care funding.
attributes.background: Reports by respected institutions such as the IFS, OBR and Nuffield Trust indicate that NHS funding per person is budgeted to fall and that future spending needs to rise to meet patient demand. Despite this, the Government refuses to increase funding even to match that of other wealthy countries.
attributes.additional_details: To remove politics as far as possible, hold a UK referendum on whether to establish an independent Commission to decide how to fund both the NHS and social care or leave it to Governments to decide. Voters would be choosing between continuing as now or having an independent Commission to set strategic funding plans, based upon need and not ideology, for Governments follow.

attributes.action: A Referendum on EU Leaving Deal
attributes.background: A Referendum to decide whether the EU Deal is acceptable to the British People is essential, BEFORE Exit.
attributes.additional_details: A number of petitions (rejected by Government)  have, in Government responses, been rejected "because the people voted to leave". The TERMS under which we leave are important: Deal? or No Deal?. (NOT "Stay in EU"). We MUST have a voice on HOW we are leaving!!! If no Referendum is granted, the next General Election will become a Vote of Confidence in the Government. Negotiators NEED a Referendum to make them concentrate on obtaining an acceptable outcome.

attributes.action: Make all ESA & PIP assessment centres fully accessible.
attributes.background: Too many people are arriving for a DWP disability assessment to discover they cannot get into the building due to steps, stairs or staff only lifts. Many of these people are being told they should have informed the assessment providers they required wheelchair access beforehand. This has to stop.

attributes.action: Brexit deal must contain a clause allowing us rejoin the EU on the same terms
attributes.background:
As a form of insurance against a potentially destructive Brexit we the undersigned petition the government to include a clause in any deal with the EU to allow us to rejoin on the exact same terms we are on now.

This will give us the ultimate get out clause if Brexit is as damaging as predicted.

attributes.action: Make the use of Smoke Bombs legal in UK Football Grounds to improve atmosphere
attributes.background: Whilst the use of smoke bombs in football grounds tend to be legal in many parts of Europe they are not in the UK. Making the use of smoke bombs in football grounds in the Uk will vastly help to improve the atmosphere of games and attendances will see a rise as a result.
attributes.additional_details: Although it is understood that smoke bombs are seen as pyrotechnics they are much less dangerous than the use of flares and fireworks which may cause a fire. On the other hand smoke bombs have very rarely caused a fire. If this was to become legal there should only be a specific place as to where the smoke grenades can be set off, this should be in the most open area of the ground should then be sign posted to make other supporters aware, if they do not wish to come into contact with the smoke.

attributes.action: Make measuring & public reporting of emissions by companies compulsory
attributes.background: Urgent action is needed to fight climate change (UN). Air pollution is responsible for 1 in 8 deaths worldwide (WHO). By making it compulsory for companies with a 500k£+ turnover to measure & report publicly reductions in their emissions we will progress much sooner towards meeting UN SDG Goal 13.
attributes.additional_details:
1) "Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts" United Nations Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) 13 (http://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/climate-change-2/)
2) "Air polution causes 1 in 8 dealths. If is the single biggest environmental crisis we face" World Health Organization (http://www.who.int/sustainable-development/news-events/breath-life/en/)

attributes.action: Establish a Royal Commission to consider a reformed National Health Service.
attributes.background: Our NHS is 70 years old. Any institution of that age needs a review. The time has come to take the future of the NHS in hand and find a non-political solution to its future. This is not just about money, but structure.

attributes.action: Build a third road coming out of  Canvey Island
attributes.background: Canvey traffic every morning and evening is ridiculous and it effects people on a day to day basis, if ever there was a major accident on the island it has been made evident by road closures it would cause chaos and hours of delays . Sign this petition to help save the island

attributes.action: Ban the sale of wild caught species in the pet trade
attributes.background: Reptiles and fish are the most affected. 100s species of fish have gone extinct over the last 100 years because of the pet trade as they have been taken from their homes. It’s the same with reptiles, invertebrates and mammals.
attributes.additional_details: Imagine being a tortoise living in the desert and one day someone comes, puts you in a cage, ships you off to somewhere you don’t know and before you know it you are behind glass, ready to be sold to people -  many of whom don’t treat their pets right . Many animals die in the transportation from their homes to the pet shop . Fish are caught using cyanide, divers spray it on the coral reef to paralyse the fish then catch them and take them to be exported worldwide. This is wrong it needs to end.

attributes.action: Repeal the ‘Licensing Act 2003’ and restore the ‘Licensing Act 1921’
attributes.background: Binge drinking has become a huge cultural problem in the UK in our towns and cities. People’s selfish behaviour accounts for 12 - 15% of attendances at emergency departments due to acute alcohol intoxication. This peaks to about 70% on Friday, Saturday nights, Christmas Eve and New Years Eve.
attributes.additional_details: Return to older licensing laws where “on” and “off” premises sales of alcohol be restricted to 9 hours in the metropolis, 8 and a half hours elsewhere and 5 hours on sundays and bank holidays. The “Licensing Act 1921” requires a two hour interval and opening hours were 11am - 11pm in London and 11am - 10pm elsewhere. This will create a culture change and reverse some of the ill effects of the liberalisation of the licensing act in 1988.

attributes.action: Give fathers automatic parental responsibility
attributes.background:
Mothers get automatic parental responsibility for a child but fathers do not
Fathers are not second class citizens and fathers helped create the child as much as the mother did

 it feels very sexist and discriminative against fathers

attributes.action: Put a Tax on all excessive packaging Including plastic and cardboard.
attributes.background: Most packaging that is being used in supermarkets is only a quarter to half full of the product. This is to make you think that you’re buying more than you’re getting. (Cardboard box) We have received a item no bigger than 5 x 4 Inches, but the box it came in was roughly 18 x12 x14 Inches.
attributes.additional_details: All companies to use no more than 10% of the packaging that is required for packing of the product.

attributes.action: To alter the trade description act so as to include new build homes
attributes.background: We would like tighter regulations in statute to enforce what is sold off plan and what is built. This should include updated quantifiable building standards with fixed time limits to rectify issue / problems with new builds. This will be enforced by daily fines, similar to over runs on the railways
attributes.additional_details: There is a ground swell of people who have been and still are facing unfair treatment due to wholly or outdated regulations. It is time UK law supported UK people not large companies.

attributes.action: Make well-being and mental health an integrated part of PSHE from KS1 to KS4.
attributes.background: PSHE currently includes Sex Education along with skills to manage finances but does not seem to address the prevalent issue of mental health. The inclusion of well-being and mindfulness within these lessons are vital beginning to tackle this issue of poor mental health amongst young people.
attributes.additional_details:
PSHE on Gov.uk website.
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/personal-social-health-and-economic-education-pshe/personal-social-health-and-economic-pshe-education

Statistics on Mental Health 
https://www.theguardian.com/mental-health-research-matters/2017/jan/20/12-statistics-to-get-you-thinking-about-mental-health-in-young-people

https://www.mind.org.uk/information-support/types-of-mental-health-problems/statistics-and-facts-about-mental-health/how-common-are-mental-health-problems/#.WueVqujwbrc

attributes.action: Make Debeaking Illegal in the egg and meat industry
attributes.background:
Debeaking is the partial removal of a chicken's beak, commonly used in the egg industry.

It has been proven that a chickens beak is highly sensitive as it is highly nervated (Davis,2004) it has also been proven chickens then have trouble eating as a result of this.
attributes.additional_details:
Debeaking is banned in Sweden, Finland, Norway (Picket H, 2008) Austria (The Ranger, 2014) and Denmark (Farming UK, 2015a). A ban was due to come in force in 2011 but it was postponed until 2016 and is still legal today.

Let's help these poor chickens!

attributes.action: Councils should be able to nominate people to a different council for downsizing
attributes.background: The Government should extend the Right to Move to tenants who want to downsize. There are so many council tenants under occupying properties that bigger families desperately need.
attributes.additional_details: All councils & housing associations should be giving tenants an incentive to move out of these bigger properties, like allowing a tenant to be nominated to a borough of the tenants choice. Local authorities shouldn’t be allowed to apply a local connection test if it could disadvantage tenants who need or want to move across local authority boundaries to downsize.

attributes.action: Cancel future cuts to the public health grant and return funding cut since 2015
attributes.background:
The public health grant funds prevention work through local authority public health departments to improve the health and well being of individuals and communities
Local authorities face a £331 million reduction to their public health budget, on top of a £200 million reduction announced in 2015.
attributes.additional_details:
*Every £1 spent on public health in UK saves an average of £14.
* cuts to the public health grant hinder preventative and health promotion work.
* Preventative programmes are essential to helping in levels of obesity and dental decay in children, increasing levels of exercise and  improving mental health and well being 
Past success in for example, reducing levels of smoking and teenage pregnancy show that it can work if resourced properly

attributes.action: Constitution to prevent ceding sovereignty to foreign powers without referendum
attributes.background:
In signing the European Communities Bill in 1972 thus taking us into the EEC without our consent, Edward Heath sacrificed our independence. Thus making the articles on the supremacy of British Parliament only of historical perspective.
He should've had referendum 1st on such constitutional change
attributes.additional_details:
In enacting the European Communities Bill through an ordinary vote in the House of Commons, Heath's Government breached the constitutional convention which requires a prior consultation of the people (either by a general election or a referendum) on any measure involving constitutional change. 
We need a constitution that is not merely convention, but that is actually written into our law to prevent this happening again.

attributes.action: Ban the use of flammable cladding on all buildings
attributes.background: The Grenfell Tower disaster shows clearly that the use of flammable cladding should be banned on all buildings.

attributes.action: Create a new permanent national UK bank holiday: "Bank holiday of Pride."
attributes.background: 2017 marked 50 year anniversary for decriminalization of homosexuality- all we got were apologies (some posthumously).
attributes.additional_details: 2018 marked 30 years since Section 28 Education clause was removed-again apology but couched with "it was protecting children". Now there are debates about trans issues and the Gender Recognition Act.

attributes.action: Stop anti-abortion campaigners from protesting outside hospitals
attributes.background: Every day, women in the UK face the hard decision to terminate a pregnancy. If this wasn’t already difficult enough, the prospect of “pro-life” campaigners picketing outside the hospital, sometimes can be enough to prohibit women from accessing the care they need due to shame, embarrassment or guilt
attributes.additional_details:
In a country where abortion is legal, why do we allow the “passive harrassment” of pro-life campaigners outside of hospital and health care settings.

Everyone is allowed to have their opinion and protest for what they believe in, but this should be nowhere near a hospital, where people are facing these heartbreaking decisions. It is inappropriate and immoral. Please help us change this, so women in the UK will not be forced to take dangerous actions to terminate pregnancy.

attributes.action: Make it law for all property floors to be soundproofed if above another property
attributes.background: Property in the UK, especially in London can be very close to one another. If you live beneath someone in a flat and they haven’t got efficient soundproofing it can be a nuisance even though the people above aren’t doing anything wrong.
attributes.additional_details: I lived in a property for three years where the noises from above became a constant nuisance. All they were doing was walking but it was an awful noise, especially at night when they would be awake at 1am. My anger was not directed at my neighbours but at the law not looking after people living beneath other people.

attributes.action: Ban Gambling Adverts Pre-Watershed
attributes.background:
This petition aims to get the government to introduce legislation to ban gambling adverts from being shown pre-watershed. 

Gambling is a huge problem in the UK, last year a Gambling Commission report finds more than 2 million people are addicted to gambling or at risk of developing a problem [1].
attributes.additional_details: [1] https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/aug/24/problem-gamblers-uk-gambling-commission-report

attributes.action: For Student Finance England to acknowledge their mistakes with payment errors!
attributes.background: In March 2018 2nd / 3rd year nursing & health care students from  universities in the UK were informed Student Finance England had mistakenly overpaid them and consequently blocked any further payments. We are aware the number of students affected is growing and could now have reached over 1000.
attributes.additional_details:
Students clarified their payment total but were reassured this was correct. Immediate payments are being demanded by SFE and have left students leaving their course due to financial pressures and is affecting the emotional wellbeing of students.

We would like: 
A public apology from SFE

To have repayment plans based on individuals circumstances

To cut interest charges on overpayments as compensation for distress

Financial support for 2nd year students to continue their training

attributes.action: Prohibit the act of infant male circumcision without a proper medical reasoning.
attributes.background: Male circumcision in infants is an unnecessary, irreversible and unfair procedure to place upon a boy who may in the future disagree with the reasons for which it was done. Religion and parental opinion are not appropriate reasons to remove a part of a boys body when they lack the ability to refuse.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition goes against strapping a infant boy to a table and cutting away at his genitals without medical reasoning. It does not go against voluntary circumcision by a consenting person.
Issue's like Phimosis, are an appropriate reason to conduct such a procedure as the condition is uncomfortable and fixable. It is known the procedure has no link to higher chances of STD's or HIV in the western world. Promoting safe sex is an alternative to preemptive surgery that is in turn irreversible.

attributes.action: Ban Vaping in public places, vaping to be included in the smoking tobacco act
attributes.background: Treat vaping with the same laws as tobacco smoking, there are toxic fumes coming from vaping, teenagers who vape could move onto cigarettes,  there will be health issues in the future if we allow this trend to continue,  let us try a curb it now before its too late,
attributes.additional_details: I'm not asking for an outright ban, only in public places

attributes.action: QTS for Indian teachers.
attributes.background: Bachelor of Education degree (B.Ed.) must be recognised as QTS ( Qualified teacher status) in UK. In the same way as teaching degrees from EEA, US, Australia & New Zealand are recognised.
attributes.additional_details: The Indian education system has produced doctors, engineers and qualified professionals, working around the world. Ironic, that our teachers cannot work with their degree in UK, but can vote here!

attributes.action: stop car insurance companies increasing premiums for no-fault accidents
attributes.background: I had two non fault accidents where the other drivers crashed into me, after which they both admitted fault. However my car insurance company still increased my premiums and called me high risk. I did not claim and at the time of each accident I was driving a company vehicle under company insurance.
attributes.additional_details: I am a class one driver and every year I have to sit a CPC course just to keep my class one license. I also have 11 years NCB on one car and 9 years on another car. I drive every day for my job and do more miles in a week than more people do in a month. But this is done in a company vehicle under company insurance.

attributes.action: Introduce consequences of prolonged pornography use into sex education
attributes.background: Symptoms of porn addiction include intense feelings of depression, shame and isolation, a disintegration of relationships with family and friends, loss of interest in non-porn activities such as school, socialising, exercise and trouble in school. Children must be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
Dr Mary Anne Layden, called porn the ‘most concerning thing to psychological health that I know of existing today.’ “The internet is a perfect drug delivery system because you are anonymous, aroused and have role models for these behaviours,”. “To have drugs pumped into your house 24/7, free, and children know how to use it better than grown-ups — it’s a perfect delivery system if we want to have a whole generation of young addicts who will never have the drug out of their minds,” she added.

"If we, as a society, shy away from talking about this issue, we are failing the thousands of young people it is affecting" Peter Liver.

The younger the user, the greater the neural response to porn, potentially for the long-term (Cambridge University Study).

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for workers under 18 years old.
attributes.background: The minimum wage for all will rise in April of 2018, but that of under 18s by a lesser amount. Young people between the ages of 16 and 18 may sustain themselves for a variety of reasons, and it is limiting, unnecessary and frankly insulting to be legally paid almost half the wage of our colleagues.
attributes.additional_details:
The gov website on the National Minimum Wage states that 'Typical hourly earnings for 16-17 year olds were £5.15 in 2014 and £6.53 for 18-20 year olds (both excluding apprentices). This compares to £11.74 for workers aged 21 and over.'

www.google.co.uk/amp/www.independent.co.uk/property/first-time-buyer-age-increase-1960s-housing-market-cost-property-ladder-a8244501.html%3famp

www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/money/2014/jan/21/record-levels-young-adults-living-home-ons

attributes.action: Revise the current council tax system which is not fit for purpose.
attributes.background: Currently properties are assigned a council tax band (A – H) according to their market value in April 1991. Band A properties under £40k whilst Band H over £320k. Despite houses prices rising considerably and disproportionately in some areas, the banding system has remained unchanged for 27 years.
attributes.additional_details:
There are insufficient bands to reflect the current value of properties and charges.  In 2017 the council tax for Band H properties worth millions in Westminster and Kensington and Chelsea was £1376 and £2124 respectively, whilst in East Sussex it was £3500 for houses worth a fraction of the price.  The system is unfair and advantages those with high value properties

One solution is increase the number of bands to reflect the current variation in house values and make the system more equitable.

attributes.action: Make the Home Secretary explain to Parliament the lack of FGM prosecutions.
attributes.background: FGM has been illigal since the passing of the Prohibition of Female Circumcision Act 1985 yet there hasn't been a single conviction despite the estimated 103 thousand girls living with the consequences of FGM the UK. Such investigations are a police matter and they answer to the Home Secretary.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/health-and-families/health-news/female-genital-mutilation-fgm-case-per-hour-uk-nhs-circumcision-a7564571.html

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/jul/05/nhs-attended-to-9000-fgm-cases-in-england-last-year-report-reveals

http://www.bbc.com/news/health-40491311

attributes.action: Government to pay for all car repairs caused by potholes
attributes.background: We all pay car tax and council tax and yet our roads are left in unsafe and damaged conditions many of witch need ripping up and relaying completely which can cause serious damage to our cars. Having paid the tax, we should not have to pay for any damage to wheels, suspension, track rods, cv joints.
attributes.additional_details: These roads are being reported yet only a temporary fix or not at all until such time the roads are safe to drive on with out the risk of damage the local council or government should pick up the bills.

attributes.action: Ban plastic drinking straws in pubs, cafes, cinemas and restaurants.
attributes.background: The use of plastic drinking straws in establishments that sell liquid refreshment, either alcoholic or non alcoholic should be banned. They are unnecessary, a waste of plastic as they are for single use only, harmful to the environment, land and sea creatures.

attributes.action: Exempt SME's from GDPR or provide tax allowance to offset the cost of compliance
attributes.background: The introduction of GDPR creates compliance and continuing costs to SME's. It is recognised that implementation has already cost billions, disproportionately for SMES. It seriously damages Export and the Service sectors. An appropriate incentive by a tax allowance to offset ongoing costs will assist
attributes.additional_details: US Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross has stated that the “GDPR “significantly interrupts transatlantic co-operation - creates unnecessary barriers to trade for everyone outside the EU". He expressed his "deep concern" about the EU's latest regulatory nightmare warning it will "significantly interrupt transatlantic co-operation, create unnecessary barriers to trade for everyone outside the EU". The costs do and will fall disproportionately on small and medium-sized businesses.

attributes.action: Mandatory registration for anyone doing social work in England
attributes.background: At the moment there is no law requiring everyone engaging in social work to register with an independent monitoring body like Social Work England. This loophole allows for dangerous levels of malpractice to take place inside the system, which could lead to, or may have already caused, child deaths.
attributes.additional_details:
Registration with an independent monitoring body is not a legal requirement for everyone doing social work. Only people calling themselves social workers or using other titles which are protected need to register.
 
There are however, several titles used by social workers which are currently unprotected, leading to cases of families being subjected to negligent care by those who use these unprotected titles to avoid the registration process, and detection.
 
All titles should be protected.
